title: Letters and Memorandums
description: Master professional correspondence formatting and style

questions.stem: Arrange the parts of a business letter in correct order:
questions.instructions: Order from top to bottom of the letter:
questions.rationale: This is the standard order for Canadian business letter format.

questions.stem: What spacing should be used between paragraphs in a business letter?

options.label: Single space within paragraphs, double space between paragraphs

questions.rationale: Canadian business letters use single spacing within paragraphs and double spacing between elements.

questions.stem: Complete the proper date format for a Canadian business letter:
questions.hint: Use the full month name and day without ordinal endings.
questions.rationale: Canadian business letters use the format: Month Day, Year (e.g., March 15, 2024).

questions.stem: Match each salutation with its appropriate use:
questions.rationale: Different salutations serve different purposes based on your knowledge of the recipient.

questions.stem: Which complimentary closing is most appropriate for a formal business letter?
questions.rationale: 'Sincerely yours' is the most formal and widely accepted closing for Canadian business correspondence.

questions.stem: Find the punctuation error in this salutation:
questions.rationale: Salutations should end with a colon (:) in business letters, not a semicolon.

questions.stem: How should titles be handled in the inside address?
questions.rationale: Use complete, properly spelled titles in the inside address for formality and accuracy.

questions.text:
Ms. Sarah ______
______ Manager
ABC Corporation
123 Main Street
______, ON M5V 3A8
questions.rationale: Canadian addresses follow: Name, Title, Organization, Street, City, Province, Postal Code.

questions.stem: Find the error in this address:
questions.text:
Mr. john smith
Senior Analyst
456 oak street
Vancouver, bc V6B 2M9
questions.rationale: Names should be properly capitalized: Mr. John Smith.

questions.stem: What are the standard header elements of a memorandum?
questions.rationale: Standard memo headers include TO, FROM, DATE, and SUBJECT in that order.

questions.text:
MEMORANDUM

__: All Staff
__: John Manager
__: March 15, 2024
__: New Office Policies
questions.rationale: These are the four standard elements of a memo header.

questions.stem: Arrange these memo characteristics from most to least formal:
questions.rationale: Formality decreases as the audience becomes smaller and more familiar.

questions.stem: Where should the attention line be placed?

options.label: Between the inside address and salutation
At the end of the letter

questions.rationale: The attention line goes between the inside address and the salutation when needed.
Subject lines typically begin with 'SUBJECT:' or 'RE:' in capital letters.

questions.stem: Match each special notation with its placement:
questions.rationale: Different notations have specific placement requirements for clarity and convention.

questions.stem: How does email formatting differ from traditional letters?

options.label: Less formal but maintain professional structure
Use only abbreviations and short forms

questions.rationale: Email can be less formal but should maintain professional standards and clear structure.

questions.stem: Find the error in this email greeting:
questions.text:
hello john,

i hope this email finds you well.
questions.rationale: Email greetings should be properly capitalized: Hello John, or Dear John,

questions.stem: Rank these email elements by importance:
questions.instructions: Most important to least important for professional email:
questions.rationale: Subject line is crucial for email management, followed by professional greeting, clear content, and proper signature.
